document.masterDocTitle: Elanela Rolston revisited (Heteroptera: Pentatomidae): new distributional records and description of new species

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1 – 8.
Dorsal view of species of Elanela Rolston, 1980 . 1 ,
Elanela hevera Rolston, 1980
, male; 2 , holotype male of
Elanela kerzhneri Grazia & Silva, 2006
; 3 , paratype male of
Elanela jordi Grazia & Greve, 2011
; 4 , holotype male of
Elanela nigrofemorata
sp. nov.
; 5 , holotype male of
Elanela diamphidiosa
sp. nov.
; 6 , holotype male of
Elanela rafaeli
sp. nov.
; 7 , holotype male of
Elanela fernandesi
sp. nov.
; 8 , holotype female of
Elanela scutomaculata
sp. nov.
Scale bars = 1 mm.

Diagnosis. Disc of scutellum black or ivory. Urosternites of females entirely yellow, and of males, with a median black stripe. Male genitalia: median portion of dorsal rim of pygophore straight, projected over segment X; ventral rim projected posteriorly, rounded, with ample quadrate notch medially; parameres spatulate, each with minute digitoid process apically; segment X slightly surpassing posterior margin of pygophore; each posterolateral angle of segment X produced posteriorly, obtuse apically; distal margin of segment X with deep, V-shaped notch. Female genitalia: gonocoxites 8 wider than long; sutural angles of gonocoxites 8 slightly reflexed; gonocoxite 9 flat, posterior margin slightly sinuate.
